Thompson Electronics PROBURNER  

 

    Proburner Manual

  

 

 

 

Proburner Screenshot

 

PROBURNER Cartridge Front

 

PROBURNER Cartridge Back

 

The Thompson Electronics PROBURNER cartridge was a truly unique and amazingly powerful tool for Atari 8bit computer users.  Produced and sold by Thompson Electronics located out of both Toronto Canada and Buffalo New York.   It is an EPROM and EEPROM reader and programming cartridge.

It is a Left Side cartridge slot, so that means it will work on all Atari 400/800, XL and XE computer systems.

One very useful and unique feature of the device is it has its own built in software.  So once the computer boots up, it will boot directly to the Proburner onboard menu program that gives the user all of the features neeeded for reading, copying and saving from chips (Cassette save is also available) as well as loading and programming (burning code) to a chip plugged into its top socket.

Another interesting and powerful feature is the ability to run code from the eprom/eeprom chip plugged into the cartridge to test it.

How the cartridge is designed and what is on it can't be seen without a lot of careful work.  The actual cartridge is very heavy because the electronics are encased in an orange resin that makes up the actual cartridge.  This gives the Proburner a very solid and sturdy structure, but also stops anyone from having access to the electronics within to examine it.

This is a top notch product and a very welcome addition to any Atari power users portfolio of tools for doing their own chip reading and programming directly on the Atari 8bit computers without using any external hardware or using something connected to a more modern PC.
